intro: Marrubium propinquum, commonly known as the common horehound, is a perennial herb native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. It has a taproot system and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Marrubium propinquum is known for its medicinal properties and has been traditionally used in herbal remedies.
